name: Basic AI Tool
description: A simple pattern-matching AI that can automate basic tasks.

educationalContent.question: Which of these was one of the earliest commercial AI applications?
answers: Expert systems for business decision making
educationalContent.explanation: Expert systems were among the first commercial applications of AI, appearing in the 1970s and 1980s. They helped businesses make decisions in specific domains by encoding human expertise as rules.

name: NLP Assistant
description: A natural language processing assistant that can understand and respond to text commands.

educationalContent.question: What was ELIZA?
answers: The first voice assistant for smartphones
A machine translation system from the 1990s
An early chatbot that simulated a psychotherapist
A chess-playing computer that beat Garry Kasparov
educationalContent.explanation: ELIZA was created by Joseph Weizenbaum at MIT in 1966 and was one of the first chatbots. It simulated a Rogerian psychotherapist by using pattern matching and substitution methodology.

name: Computer Vision System
description: An AI system that can recognize and interpret visual information from images and video.

educationalContent.question: What breakthrough technology in the 2010s revolutionized computer vision?
educationalContent.explanation: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) achieved breakthrough performance in image recognition tasks around 2012 with AlexNet, which dramatically improved accuracy on the ImageNet challenge and led to rapid advancement in computer vision.

name: Advanced Language Model
description: A sophisticated neural language model capable of generating human-like text and answering complex questions.

educationalContent.question: What innovation enabled large language models to better understand context?
answers: The transformer architecture with attention mechanisms
educationalContent.explanation: The transformer architecture, introduced in the 'Attention is All You Need' paper in 2017, revolutionized NLP by using attention mechanisms that enabled models to better understand context across long sequences of text.
